function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Changes in global wind patterns and increased rainfall can propagate the spread of malaria during the construction life cycle.","Impact":"Increased risk of malaria transmission and infection.","Mitigation":"Implement proper drainage systems and mosquito control measures.","Technologies":"Drainage systems, mosquito nets, insecticide spraying.","People":"Construction workers, local residents, and communities near construction sites.","Owner":"Construction companies, local health authorities, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Increased precipitation, relative humidity, and temperature conditions can create a more suitable habitat for the malaria vector.","Impact":"Higher breeding potential for malaria-causing mosquitoes.","Mitigation":"Monitoring and controlling environmental conditions, implementing mosquito control measures.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems, mosquito nets, insecticide spraying.","People":"Construction workers, local residents, and communities near construction sites.","Owner":"Construction companies, local health authorities, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Pools of stagnant water developing in areas of intense excavation and earth removal work during the construction phase provide breeding grounds for malaria-causing mosquitoes.","Impact":"Increased breeding potential for malaria-causing mosquitoes.","Mitigation":"Implement proper drainage systems, fill or treat stagnant water areas, and use mosquito control measures.","Technologies":"Drainage systems, water treatment solutions, mosquito nets.","People":"Construction workers, local residents, and communities near construction sites.","Owner":"Construction companies, local health authorities, and government agencies."}]}
